alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 7:17PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Humboldt, northern Lander and western Elko Counties through 745 PM PDT... At 717 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Valmy, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall along with gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Humboldt, northern Lander and western Elko Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
